intro: Sericorema sericea, commonly known as silky sericorema, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its delicate, silky-haired leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The species is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants.
